DataElement.preferredName: Agreement Central Pathology Review Glioblastoma Gliosarcoma Performed Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether GBM/gliosarcoma was confirmed by central pathology.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Agreement Central Pathology Review Glioblastoma Gliosarcoma Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to agreement (the act of agreeing) between separate central pathology reviews (the process by which specimens are sent to a central lab for confirmatory analysis using standardized methods and result criteria, in order to minimize inter-reviewer differences and improve the accuracy of pathology data) being performed (carried out) on glioblastoma (a malignant form of astrocytoma histologically characterized by pleomorphism of cells, nuclear atypia, microhemorrhage, and necrosis) and gliosarcoma (a type of glioma, cancer of the brain that comes from glial, or supportive, cells).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: 1. The act of agreeing. 2. Harmony of opinion; accord. (from American Heritage Dictionary):The process by which specimens are sent to a central lab for confirmatory analysis using standardized methods and result criteria in order to minimize inter-reviewer differences thereby improving the accuracy of pathology data.

Concepts.definition: The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.

The process by which specimens are sent to a central lab for confirmatory analysis using standardized methods and result criteria in order to minimize inter-reviewer differences thereby improving the accuracy of pathology data.

Property.preferredDefinition: A malignant form of astrocytoma histologically characterized by pleomorphism of cells, nuclear atypia, microhemorrhage, and necrosis. They may arise in any region of the central nervous system, with a predilection for the cerebral hemispheres, basal ganglia, and commissural pathways. Clinical presentation most frequently occurs in the fifth or sixth decade of life with focal neurologic signs or seizures.:A type of glioma (cancer of the brain that comes from glial, or supportive, cells).:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The most malignant astrocytic tumor (WHO grade 4).  It is composed of poorly differentiated neoplastic astrocytes and is characterized by the presence of cellular polymorphism, nuclear atypia, brisk mitotic activity, vascular thrombosis, microvascular proliferation, and necrosis. It typically affects adults and is preferentially located in the cerebral hemispheres. (Adapted from WHO)
A rare histological variant of glioblastoma (WHO grade IV) characterized by a biphasic tissue pattern with alternating areas displaying glial and mesenchymal differentiation (WHO).
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Histologically confirmed glioblastoma multiforme as determined by pre-registration central pathology review

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Histological confirmation of glioblastoma multiforme as determined by pre-registration central pathology review

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Histologically proven diagnosis of glioblastoma (WHO grade IV) confirmed by central review prior to step 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is tumor tissue block available for retrospective central pathology review after registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Histologic diagnosis of glioblastoma (WHO Grade IV) or pilocytic astrocytoma (WHO Grade I).

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC-1602 Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a histologically confirmed glioblastoma or gliosarcoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Elig_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Histologically proven diagnosis of glioblastoma or gliosarcoma (WHO grade IV)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a histopathologically proven diagnosis of glioblastoma (or gliosarcoma as a subtype of glioblastoma) confirmed by central pathology review?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF 1801 v4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Histologically proven diagnosis of glioblastoma or gliosarcoma (WHO grade IV) obtained at the time of a partial or gross total resection of the tumor. Patients who undergo a stereotactic needle biopsy alone are not eligible.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have histopathologically proven diagnosis of glioblastoma, OR molecular diagnosis of glioblastoma per c-IMPACT-NOW criteria?
